document.discussion_title: How To Play Golf For Just 75 Cents Today
document.topic_text: How To Play Golf For Just 75 Cents Today Gillespie Golf Course Offers $0.75 Greens Fees Eric Chilton, WFMY 8:47 AM. EST April 25, 2016 Rockingham County’s consistency enabled it to win the team title. (Photo: WFMY News 2 Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN GOOGLE+ PINTEREST The City of Greensboro's Gillespie Golf Course is celebrating its 75th anniversary this summer and is starting its summer-long celebration Monday, April 25 with a one-day promotion of 75-cent green fees. Tee times are encouraged, but not required. The course is open from 8 am until sunset. Gillespie Golf Course opened in 1941 as a nine-hole course on 80 acres of rolling hill-country located a short distance from the center of the city. In 1991, major alterations produced an additional set of tees, which now provides an opportunity to play the course as an 18-hole course. The 75-cent green fee does not include use of a cart, which is $6 for 9 holes and $10 for 18 holes. Gillespie Golf Course is located at 306 E. Florida St. To make a tee time or for more information, contact the Gillespie Golf Course club house at 336-373-5850. Copyright 2016 WFMY
